{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3422046,"name":"crollison","username":"crollison","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/87869e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-09T15:20:01.182Z","cooked":"

We moved to Java last year and had one programmer. He graduated and our plan was to start early this year and start training others. But we have a demo this weekend and had to swap out a motor controller for one that was broken. We are having to use some older motor controllers for the replacement. If there is anyone who could look over the code, it’s not pretty I warn you and see how we can get the TalonSRX going, it would be greatly appreciated. It was on a Spark, but we swapped it out. I thought I had it, but the actual set commands are not working right.

Everything is in the DriveTrain subsystem as the Shooter subsystem listed wasn’t working correctly so we moved everything over.

Thanks for any help. Here is a link to the code.

github.com

Yes, the biggest problem is I can’t even get it to build the code, I have errors in the set command and VSCode will not let it though.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-09-09T17:46:33.640Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":43,"readers_count":42,"score":33.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":470954,"topic_slug":"code-help","display_username":"crollison","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":54372,"username":"krylez","name":"Riley Brewer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/krylez/{size}/176730_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12865,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/code-help/470954/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3422100,"name":"Joe Witcpalek","username":"wits","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wits/{size}/110752_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-09T17:55:13.801Z","cooked":"

You are making the following call:

TalonSRX leftDart = new TalonSRX();

And you have a class TalonSRX which doesn’t seem to do anything.

What you want is something similar to the CTRE examples where you use the WPI_TalonSRX (see Phoenix5-Examples/Java General/MagEncoder_Absolute/src/main/java/frc/robot/Robot.java at master · CrossTheRoadElec/Phoenix5-Examples · GitHub).

So, you would construct it with a line similar to:

WPI_TalonSRX _talon = new WPI_TalonSRX(2);

Where the 2 is the CAN ID that is set in the Phoenix Tuner X for this motor controller.

Then you can reset to factory defaults to make sure there isn’t some setting that will get you later:

	_talon.configFactoryDefault();

Then it looks like all you’re doing is calling the set method with percent outputs which should work.

You may need to do things like invert the motor as well.

Also, you indicate there are build errors:

One possible cause is did you pull in the ctre vendor dependency?

Thank you, I had everything before with the WPI_TalonSRX on the left side, but didn’t have the right info on the right. Code is pushed and I think we are good to go.
